name: Sounds of the Ocean at Arcadia Earth
description:
Embark on an extraordinary journey beneath the waves in celebration of World Ocean Month. 

This award-winning, 10-minute immersive experience will transport guests into the mesmerizing world of the deep blue. Lounge on soft seating as the ethereal songs and sounds create a meditative ocean odyssey. Act Locally, think globally as Arcadia Earth Toronto works in collaboration with the Canadian Ocean Literacy Coalition (COLC) to share actionable steps to protect our oceans. Showcased in 26 countries, enjoy this experience in Toronto!

name: Mykonos Paint Night Workshop
description: Paint a little slice of Greece featuring a charming blue door with the ocean just beyond. It’s the perfect way to unwind, get creative, and feel like you’ve taken a mini escape, no passport or experience needed.

name: Luminato, Night/Shifts
description: Toronto Photo Laureate Nadya Kwandibens’ Night/Shifts captures the lives of Toronto’s night workers through striking photography displayed across the TTC and beyond. From healthcare staff to nightlife workers, this exhibition offers a poignant glimpse into the unseen world of those who keep the city running at night.

name: Art Socials
description:
Back by popular demand! This season, we invite you to come together throughout the summer season for a fun-filled evening of beginner-friendly art activities. Try something new, connect with neighbours, and learn art techniques across a variety of entry-level crafting.

Curious to try screen printing? Haven’t made a collage in a while? Try both this summer plus watercolour painting, letterpress, drawing cartoons, and more. Each class is a standalone workshop so sign up for just one or come back weekly to try something new. All materials will be provided.

name: Kiki Lounge Wednesdays
description: Join us for our Kiki Lounge Nights - a space to celebrate creativity, community, and self-expression through vogue and ballroom culture! Come walk, dance, chill, and connect with your community. Curated by icon Twysted legendary Kitana Siriano. All are welcome! This all leads up to the second annual Jane and Finch Pride Ball on Sunday June 22, 2025. Free Entry | Safe Space | All Ages

name: Maria Chávez - Dusk Soundscapes
description: A leading voice in sound art and DJing, Maria Chávez creates a living soundscape that shifts and evolves as the sun sets. Attuned to the room, the audience, listen to the blends of fractured records, ambient tones, and pulsing beats. As daylight fades, soft ambient sounds and crackling vinyl will fill the space, creating a meditative atmosphere. The energy builds, and as night falls, Chávez transforms the space into a celebration, inviting audiences to dance.

name: Koffler Arts Presents WONDER - Sage Szkabarnicki-Stuart
description:
Thrilled to welcome Sage Szkabarnicki-Stuart as the inaugural artist in our new gallery space, Koffler301, for a solo exhibition, curated by David Liss. The exhibition, highlights the intersection of early cinema, vaudeville and slapstick comedy, advertising, social media, performance, and contemporary art.

“My practice, focused on self-portraiture, draws upon the work of Cindy Sherman by appropriating contemporary commercial aesthetics and styles, typically created by large teams of professionals working for prominent brands, to focus on fleeting emotions and mundane objects,” says Szkabarnicki-Stuart.

name: Wednesday Night Dinner RnB Disco with Daisy Street
description: We’re a band from Toronto that plays RnB, disco, jazz and neo soul. We go from classic tracks to newer sounds, always focusing on rhythm, groove and having a good time. For us, playing live is about enjoying the music and making sure the crowd feels it too. We keep things fun and energetic, with a sound that’s made to get people dancing.

name: Pride Flag Raising at Montgomery's Inn
description:
Join us for the Pride Flag Raising at Montgomery's Inn! This event at the Wednesday Farmers Market will celebrate the diversity of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community in our neighbourhood. Hear heartfelt stories from community members and enjoy the festivities. 

We can't wait to celebrate with you!
image: https://secure.toronto.ca/webapps/CC/fileAPI/edc_eventcal/Simple World Health Day Wellness Facebook Post_g7wHbhn2nGfUSlPeWuf88Q.png

name: Starry Paint Night Workshop
description: Paint like one of the greats. We'll show you step by step how to recreate this piece with the option to pick your own colours and composition. Enjoy a fun yet relaxing creative experience at this paint night designed for beginners and experienced artists alike.

name: Luminato at Harbourfront Centre

location.name: Harbourfront Centre - location details for installations available on website

description:
Join us for a weekend of provocative art installations, a new take on Shakespeare, global food vendors and live music celebrations.

Explore Terceradix Luminarium, an immersive world of light and First Breath, a glowing tribute to new life. Groove to the chart-topping sounds of the legendary Quincy Jones with Grammy Award-winning artist Larnell Lewis and experience South Asian rhythms from the Tawoos Initiative, Latin beats from Lula Music and Arts Centre and music from Indigenous artists presented by Miigwetch Collective. Lastly, don't miss the reimagined and revolutionary take on Shakespeare’s most famous play, Hamlet, from acclaimed Peruvian director Chela De Ferrari.

name: Labatt Studio Artists
description: A group of east end artists with different styles, techniques, and artistic visions inspired and united by a vibrant and unique studio space and each other.
